intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: This can't go on, Elder! We barely have enough to get us by as it is!

intro.speaker: Elder
intro.line: Their leader is a former Valmese general! We'll be crushed if we resist...

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Elder! He may be able to help us!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Um, I can hear you. But tell me your problem, and I'll see what I can do.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Urgent news, sir! Armed soldiers approach! Their leader claims to be Chrom of Ylisse!

intro.speaker: Nelson
intro.line: Dammit! Why would he come here? Well, if they insist on dogging me, I've got hounds of my own to welcome them with.

intro.speaker: Nelson
intro.line: No, only a stray mutt that refuses to stop yapping. But you'll be a good dog and do as I say if you ever want--

intro.speaker: Severa
intro.line: Yes, yes, if I ever want to see it again. I'm well aware.

intro.speaker: Nelson
intro.line: I trust you're equally aware of your position, Holland?

intro.speaker: Nelson
intro.line: Loquacious as ever, I see. You'll fight for me, or I'll have that lazy tongue pried from your head. Now, then, Chrom may have the Fire Emblem in his possession... And if I claim that, I've practically claimed the throne. So go out there, kill anything that moves, and get me that Emblem!

battle.speaker: Severa
battle.line: Holland, no! You idiot! Now you'll never get to see your wife again or meet your new child... I guess I shouldn't be surprised. Families never stay together...

battle.speaker: Holland
battle.line: Severa! What are you doing here? If he knows you left your post...

battle.speaker: Severa
battle.line: I'm leaving, Holland, and you're coming with me.

battle.speaker: Holland
battle.line: Severa, I... I can't. You know I can't. I have a wife. If I don't earn Nelson's coin, she'll starve. I know it's blood money, but--

battle.speaker: Severa
battle.line: Your wife is PREGNANT, Holland! You know that, don't you?!

battle.speaker: Holland
battle.line: Of course I know that! And it's none of your concern!

battle.speaker: Severa
battle.line: Do you love your child, Holland? Do you love your wife?

battle.speaker: Severa
battle.line: Then stop making excuses! I know that parents will do anything for their children... But I also know how it feels when a child loses her parents. This world's got far too many kids who've gone through that. If you stay, you'll be killed or worse. And your child deserves better!

battle.speaker: Holland
battle.line: Severa, I... I'm sorry. I didn't know. That must have been hard for you. ...... You're right. My child deserves better. Let's get out of here.

battle.speaker: Holland
battle.line: Yes, really. But we have to hurry!

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: ...Oh, gods. It's you.

battle-talk.speaker: Cordelia
battle-talk.line: Have we met? If so, I'm afraid I've quite forgotten.

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: Well, excuse me for being so forgettable!

battle-talk.speaker: Cordelia
battle-talk.line: Look, there's no time for this. If you're a friend, speak now. If not, then stay out of Chrom's way or I'll have to cut you down.

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: Chrom, Chrom, Chrom! It's ALWAYS Chrom with you!

battle-talk.speaker: Cordelia
battle-talk.line: ...I'm sorry?

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: You should be! And I don't care about your stupid Chrom, so you can just drop it! ...I only want to talk to Holland.

battle-talk.speaker: Cordelia
battle-talk.line: Holland?

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: Yes, Holland! That sad sack over there. Watch my back so I can get to him safely, and then I'll help your stupid army!

battle-talk.speaker: Cordelia
battle-talk.line: O...okay?

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: Oh, and Holland's not here of his own will, so don't you dare hurt him!

battle-talk.speaker: Chrom
battle-talk.line: What's a child doing here?

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: Child? I'm not a child, you oaf! I'm... Wait, are you the enemy general?

battle-talk.speaker: Chrom
battle-talk.line: I don't know. Are we enemies?

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: You're Chrom, aren't you? You're Lucina's father.

battle-talk.speaker: Chrom
battle-talk.line: That's right. ...And I suppose you came back here with my daughter?

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: Oh, good. Now I won't have to waste time explaining the situation. ...Weird. I didn't think you'd be so funny looking.

battle-talk.speaker: Chrom
battle-talk.line: You're a real charmer. But charm or not, if you can fight, you're welcome to join our cause.

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: Not the snappiest pick-up line I've heard, but I suppose it gets the job done. But I can't leave until I reclaim my property from Nelson. We'll talk then.

battle-talk.speaker: Chrom
battle-talk.line: Actually, we're here to take stolen goods back to the village. If I promise to add yours to the list, will that persuade you?

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: Mmm... Maybe. But you'll have to help my friend Holland, too. He's a bit of a sad sack, but he doesn't want to be here either.

battle-talk.speaker: Chrom
battle-talk.line: Will he listen to reason?

battle-talk.speaker: Severa
battle-talk.line: He will if I talk to him. He listens to pretty much whatever I say. Don't worry, he hates Nelson, too. Just be sure not to hurt him.

battle-talk.speaker: Chrom
battle-talk.line: We'll be careful.

boss.speaker: Nelson
boss.line: What are those useless fools doing?! Get them! Somebody get them!

boss.speaker: Nelson
boss.line: Damn... Useless fools, all of you!

boss.speaker: Chrom
boss.line: And what does that make the man cowering behind them?

boss.speaker: Nelson
boss.line: Bah! I'll use your corpse to clean the blood from my boots!

boss.speaker: Severa
boss.line: You've got to be loyal before you can be a traitor, you idiot! And you're one to talk, extorting a poor innocent girl like me...it's time you learned just how deadly this innocent girl can be!

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: You've saved the village from starvation! You're a true hero of the people, sir.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: Yes, here it is!

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Is that a ring?

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: It's my ring, and I'll thank you to stop staring so lustily at it! It's worth more to me than anything in the world to me... That rat Nelson stole it one night while I was sleeping.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Well, I'm glad you were able to get it back.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: ...Hmph.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: Oh. ...You.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: Wh-what do you want?!

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: Just to thank you for helping us. You fought bravely, er...

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: Severa. ...My name's Severa.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: It suits you somehow. Oh, and my name--

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: Cordelia. I know.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: Er, yes, that's... But how did you...? I'm sorry, did I introduce myself before?

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: I guess you must have if I know your name. Gods...

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: I... I see. Well, thank you all the same, Severa.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: You already said that! And besides, it's not like I did anything special. I was just fighting to get back what's rightfully mine.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: Are you referring to that ring? Oh, goodness. It looks exactly like... Ah I see. That would explain how you know my name. You're a friend of Lucina's, aren't you? ...And you're my child. Isn't that right?

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: *Mutter* *grumble* ...lonely...

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: What was that?

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: I SAID, I thought you'd might be lonely, so I came here to see you! ...You're welcome.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: That's very sweet.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: D-don't mock me! You don't care! You don't care at all!

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: How could you possibly think that? I'm thrilled beyond words to meet you.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: ...Then why'd you leave me? You said you had to go off to fight for what really mattered, and you never came back! You picked Chrom over me!

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: You have me at a disadvantage, Severa. I can't answer for my future self. But when I said I was fighting for what mattered, I probably meant you. I'd want nothing more than to build a world where you could grow up happy and strong. At least, that's what I want right now.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: You think I don't know that...? I mean, I DO know that, but...

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: I'm sorry I wasn't a better mother to you.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: Well, you're still MY mother, which makes you the best mother in the world.

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: And the luckiest, it seems.

end.speaker: Severa
end.line: Oh, Mom, I missed you so much! I... I'm sorry I was so mean... I just... I didn't want to lose you again... Promise you won't leave, okay? Promise!

end.speaker: Cordelia
end.line: I promise.
